home.content: # Lecture 8: Developer Matchmaker --- Welcome! **IT'S LAB DAY.** ### Learning Objectives --- **EFFING FLOATS:** HOW DO THEY WORK?! Also, how do we apply all that we learned thus far into a cohesive, professional looking and functional website? ### Instructions --- We are going to be building this (**with a partner**). ### Step 1 --- Diagram out the layout of your page using boxes. **Draw the diagram out on your desks**. 1. I want to see a diagram similar to what we did for Sartre's List and other layout exercises. 2. Make sure you also display which items need a clearfix parent. ### Step 2 --- Clear (haha, get it?) your schematic with Pete or Taq. We will be walking around to sign you off. ### Step 3 --- Build your website. Here is the **[starter kit](https://github.com/FEWDMaterials/FEWD_Developer_Matchmaker)**. 1. Make sure to use semantic tags such as article, section, etc 2. **Hint**: you will need ```background-size: cover``` to solve one of the challenges. 3. **Hint 2**: Here's the **[completed project](https://fewdmaterials.github.io/developer_matchmaker/)**. Don't cheat! But resize this page and get an understanding of how these elements need to behave. Incorporate these behaviors to your implementation

desc.content: Lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab lab.
